channel.title: Really relaxed dev team
channel.description:
Hey guys. So basically. I want to make a dev team for my server. BUT, it's nothing serious. What I mean is: There are no deadlines. You're not pressured to finish work. You don't have to "Work". You can code when you feel like it*.
Why? I find working while stressed just makes things harder than you need it. You also may not do your best work because you were worried about hitting that deadline, instead of making a 'flawless' product. This type of team and project will give you not give you just the freedom you need, but the freedom you want as well.
I do have a client and server. I do have my website. I don't have a VPS, that will be figured out. My project is a 317 PI. If you've ever met me, that's all I ever use. Yes, I know PI is shit or whatever you want to call it. Yes, I know there are better bases I can use. Yes, you can shut the fu[b][/b]ck up about it now.
I am looking for, at most, 2 more developers.
Here is some content directly from my server. [url=http://rsps.canyourcode.com/Bank/index.php]Online bank viewer with privacy settings[/url] [url=http://rsps.canyourcode.com/drops/index.php]Online rare drop viewer, also has privacy settings[/url] I plan on adding more features to this. [url=http://rsps.canyourcode.com/highscores/]HiScores[/url]
Owners and players that have access to ::master, ::item, and related commands do not show up on the hiscores, as they can boost their exp faster than regular players.
An updated version of this is also added to my server. (I wrote the original, for those that don't know) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KSVTxU6v86c
My skype can be found on my profile. Other ways to contact me are via reply, or private message.

item.title: Really relaxed dev team
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Make a rainbow colored partyhat load via cache?

Edit:
Unless you guys are talking about something completely different here.

Read full topic

unless you do something like the fire cape I have no idea how a model would work here

item.title: Really relaxed dev team
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:545307”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=664188.msg4440391#msg4440391 date=1406433466]

my beloved rainbow phat.

k

definitely mine
[/quote]lolwut? Rainbow partyhats were in 2007-2008 Delta servers. Urcoolbrah - obviously don’t remember the past.

No no, he released some code to make your partyhat cycle on your head, so it’s “rainbow”.

I used parts of his code for my hat, along with code for bug fixes to prevent dupes. (I found like 8 ways to dupe that phat lol)[/quote]

It was only ever meant for me to use, obviously I wouldn’t dupe on my own server, and even if I did, I’m not going to give anything away…

Uncalled:

Oh, well actually… That’s actually pretty shitty. A model would be more efficient. From my assumption, that is. I’ve actually never seen his code for it.

I’d like to know how you’d plan on doing that with a model.

Read full topic

item.title: Really relaxed dev team
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

wildskiller:

Just, nevermind… This is why servers fail to achieve anything.

I’m not looking to become a huge server. I don’t even care if my server goes viral or anything.
I’m just having a fun and relaxing time developing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Really relaxed dev team
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:545307”][quote author=wildskiller link=topic=664188.msg4440355#msg4440355 date=1406422164]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664188.msg4439855#msg4439855 date=1406206153]I find working while stressed just makes things harder than you need it. You also may not do your best work because you were worried about hitting that deadline, instead of making a ‘flawless’ product. This type of team and project will give you not give you just the freedom you need, but the freedom you want as well.

You are expected to have to ability to work under pressure with the same skill as when you aren’t. I seriously think that putting deadlines on content creation will assess the feel of professionalism; causing more interest within the programmer community. What you are expecting is lazy, so there is less of a chance to get anything done. So, I would say put up an array of things sorted by importance to be fixed or added.

I just think it’s more psychological than anything when it comes to believing it’s more professional.

Yes, but the difference is this isn’t like a job. Well, in some minor aspects it is, but not fully.
At a job you get paid an hourly wage. At a job you also have more responsibilities. And it’s a lot more serious.
I just want a project that me and a couple people can work on, and not be too serious about it. Rushing to complete things can make the final product worse than it should be.

-On the topic of my server-
I’ve added the dwarf cannon, an achievement system, and my beloved rainbow phat.
[/quote]
I understand completely what you are saying, but there isn’t motivation if there isn’t a goal.
[/quote]
There is a goal, to get it hosted.
Lol.[/quote]
Just, nevermind… This is why servers fail to achieve anything.

Read full topic

item.description:

You also may not do your best work because you were worried about hitting that deadline, instead of making a ‘flawless’ product. This type of team and project will give you not give you just the freedom you need, but the freedom you want as well.

You are expected to have to ability to work under pressure with the same skill as when you aren’t. I seriously think that putting deadlines on content creation will assess the feel of professionalism; causing more interest within the programmer community. What you are expecting is lazy, so there is less of a chance to get anything done. So, I would say put up an array of things sorted by importance to be fixed or added.

I just think it’s more psychological than anything when it comes to believing it’s more professional.
[/quote]
Yes, but the difference is this isn’t like a job. Well, in some minor aspects it is, but not fully.
At a job you get paid an hourly wage. At a job you also have more responsibilities. And it’s a lot more serious.
I just want a project that me and a couple people can work on, and not be too serious about it. Rushing to complete things can make the final product worse than it should be.

-On the topic of my server-
I’ve added the dwarf cannon, an achievement system, and my beloved rainbow phat.
[/quote]
I understand completely what you are saying, but there isn’t motivation if there isn’t a goal.[/quote]
There is a goal, to get it hosted.
Lol.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Hey guys. So basically. I want to make a dev team for my server. BUT, it’s nothing serious.
What I mean is:
There are no deadlines.
You’re not pressured to finish work.
You don’t have to “Work”. You can code when you feel like it*.

Why?
I find working while stressed just makes things harder than you need it. You also may not do your best work because you were worried about hitting that deadline, instead of making a ‘flawless’ product. This type of team and project will give you not give you just the freedom you need, but the freedom you want as well.

I do have a client and server. I do have my website. I don’t have a VPS, that will be figured out.
My project is a 317 PI. If you’ve ever met me, that’s all I ever use. Yes, I know PI is shit or whatever you want to call it. Yes, I know there are better bases I can use. Yes, you can shut the fuck up about it now.

I am looking for, at most, 2 more developers.

Here is some content directly from my server.
Online bank viewer with privacy settings
Online rare drop viewer, also has privacy settings I plan on adding more features to this.
HiScores

Owners and players that have access to ::master, ::item, and related commands do not show up on the hiscores, as they can boost their exp faster than regular players.

An updated version of this is also added to my server. (I wrote the original, for those that don’t know)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KSVTxU6v86c

My skype can be found on my profile. Other ways to contact me are via reply, or private message.
